infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class MultiInfoCalculatorGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.MultiInfoCalculatorGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, MultiInfoCalculator

    public class MultiInfoCalculatorGaussian
extends MultiInfoCalculatorCommon

    Computes the differential multi-information of a given multivariate double[][] set of observations (implementing MultiInfoCalculator), assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is a multivariate Gaussian distribution.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MultiInfoCalculator, with:

    • For constructors see the child classes.
    • Further properties are defined in MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.setProperty(String, String).
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Pedro A.M. Mediano (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • finaliseAddObservations

        public void finaliseAddObservations()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
        Signal that the observations are now all added, PDFs can now be constructed. This class provides a basic implementation, generating the internal set of samples in observations; child classes should then process these observations as required.
        Specified by:
        finaliseAddObservations in interface MultiInfoCalculator
        Overrides:
        finaliseAddObservations in class MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setCovariance

        public void setCovariance(double[][] cov)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the multi-information directly, without supplying observations.

        See setCovariance(double[][], boolean).

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of the system
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for covariance matrix not matching the expected dimensions, being non-square, asymmetric or non-positive definite

      • setCovarianceAndMeans

        public void setCovarianceAndMeans(double[][] covariance,
                         double[] means)
                           throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the multi-information.

        This is an alternative to sequences of calls to MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.setObservations(double[][]) or MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.addObservations(double[][]) etc. Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations().

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of the system variables, considered together (variable indices start with the source and continue into the destination).
        means - mean of the system
        numObservations - the number of observations that the mean and covariance were determined from. This is used for later significance calculations
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setCovariance

        public void setCovariance(double[][] cov,
                 boolean covFromObservations)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

        Set the covariance of the distribution for which we will compute the multi-information.

        This is an alternative to sequences of calls to MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.setObservations(double[][]) or MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.addObservations(double[][]) etc. Note that without setting any observations, you cannot later call computeLocalOfPreviousObservations(), and without providing the means of the variables, you cannot later call computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][]).

        Parameters:
        covariance - covariance matrix of the system
        determinedFromObservations - whether the covariance matrix was determined internally from observations or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for covariance matrix not matching the expected dimensions, being non-square, asymmetric or non-positive definite

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the average multi-info in nats (not bits!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception

        Computes the local values of the multi-information, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        If the samples were supplied via a single call i.e. MultiInfoCalculator.setObservations(double[][]), then the return value is a single time-series of local channel measure values corresponding to these samples.

        Otherwise where disjoint time-series observations were supplied using several calls such as MultiInfoCalculator.addObservations(double[][]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single "time-series" return array.

        Returns:
        the "time-series" of local multi-info values in nats (not bits!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local multi-information values for each of the supplied samples in states.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in states (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Parameters:
        states - series of multivariate observations (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        Returns:
        the "time-series" of local multi-info values in nats (not bits!) for the supplied states.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
